New Records: Ryan Mendes made history for his country with his second goal of the tournament
Key Match Events: Ryan Mendes scored a late penalty to give Cape Verde a 1-0 victory over Mauritania
Mauritania had a fine chance just before the hour mark, but Souleymane Anne put his shot over
Cape Verde goalkeeper Vozinha made crucial saves throughout the match
Pre-Game Insights: Cape Verde coach Pedro 'Bubista' Brito believes his side can go further still in the tournament
Mauritania had been hoping to extend their fine run in CÃ´te d'Ivoire after winning an AFCON match for the first time in nine attempts
Post-Match Reflections: Cape Verde coach Pedro 'Bubista' Brito praised his team's performance and expressed his confidence in their ability to go further in the tournament
Mauritania coach Amir Abdou reflected on their team's naivety and expressed regret over their loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cape Verde will face either Morocco or South Africa in the quarter-finals
The match at the Felix Houphouet Boigny Stadium in Abidjan was drifting towards extra time before Cape Verde won a spot-kick
Others: The tiny Atlantic Ocean island nation of Cape Verde had got out of their group in two of their three previous appearances at the AFCON, but had never before won a knockout tie
